docs.snippet: In a valedictory address to veterans during a presidential campaign in which their issues have been front and center, President Barack Obama will argue that getting ex-military members the health care and benefits they've earned is a national prom...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a valedictory address to veterans during a presidential campaign in which their issues have been front and center, President Barack Obama will argue that getting ex-military members the health care and benefits they've earned is a national promise that "can't be broken." He'll also tout administration progress on reducing homelessness among veterans.

headline.main: Obama to Cite Progress on Veterans' Issues in Monday Speech
headline.print_headline: Obama to Cite Progress on Veterans' Issues in Monday Speech

docs.snippet: Virginia Sen. Tim Kaine's name on the Democratic ticket can realistically nudge this pivotal state closer into Hillary Clinton's column — no small feat in a contest of two presidential nominees that engender strong feelings by themselves....
